channel.title: New items
channel.description:
Ok so i added a new platebody and when I spawn it and put it on it goes to my attack spot when it should go to the chest area.. What should I do.
And yes i did set ints
________________
for ferity
Ok to add new items you download a model.. and then you would gzip it and add it to your model folder of your client and then you set ints in class8.java and add it to item.cfg so you can spawn it.. compile everything.. close your client and open it. then type add models do not add :: .. but if it doesnt lagg you and then say add model 13442 @@@ and all that other random stuff you know it worked.. So re open your client and restart your server and spawn the item.. there you go and thanks for the info

item.title: New items
item.dc:creator: @Ferity Ferity
item.description:
@Ferity wrote:

Open item.java, then search for

public static int body[] = {

after the bracket add the item ID of your body, and tadaa it’s done, not hard huh?

Could you tell me how to add new items?

Read full topic

item.title: New items
item.dc:creator: @n00bf0rlyf3 n00bf0rlyf3
item.description:
@n00bf0rlyf3 wrote:

Ok so i added a new platebody and when I spawn it and put it on it goes to my attack spot when it should go to the chest area… What should I do.

And yes i did set ints

for ferity

Ok to add new items you download a model… and then you would gzip it and add it to your model folder of your client and then you set ints in class8.java and add it to item.cfg so you can spawn it… compile everything… close your client and open it. then type add models do not add :: … but if it doesnt lagg you and then say add model 13442 @@@ and all that other random stuff you know it worked… So re open your client and restart your server and spawn the item… there you go and thanks for the info
